title: Economy’s Fate Might Hinge on Question of ‘Full Employment’
sub_head: Some see low unemployment, high inflation as signs job market is as healthy as it can get
body:
The winter slowdown in job growth and sharply rising inflation are igniting a key policy debate: Is the U.S. at “full employment”?
Full employment refers to the state at which anyone who wants a job can get one, without wages and prices rising out of control. It is the ideal of a healthy, steadily growing economy.
